name: Ch10BBaseConvo1
_source: speak;Vanessa;Amelia, isn't it?|I don't think we've had a proper chance to talk.|How are you settling in with our forces?
speak;Amelia;O-oh! Dame Vanessa!|Yes, I'm Amelia.|Everyone has been very kind to me.
speak;Vanessa;That's good to hear.|It must be quite an adjustment.|Fighting alongside those you once faced in battle.
speak;Amelia;It is strange, yes.|But...|I know I made the right choice.
speak;Vanessa;What made you decide to change sides?|If you don't mind my asking.
speak;Amelia;When I saw how Prince Ephraim treated his soldiers...|How he fought alongside them instead of behind them...|It was nothing like what I was used to.
speak;Vanessa;Your previous commander was different, I take it?
speak;Amelia;Commander Gheb...|He was...|I'm sorry, but he was a terrible man.
speak;Vanessa;I've heard stories.|Was it as bad as they say?
speak;Amelia;Worse.|He treated female soldiers like...|Well, not like soldiers at all.
speak;Amelia;His eyes would always...|And he would say such things...
speak;Vanessa;I understand.|You don't need to elaborate.
speak;Amelia;He wouldn't even train with us!|He'd just sit there eating and...|watching.
speak;Vanessa;How did someone like that become a commander?|Surely not on merit.
speak;Amelia;That's the strange part.|There was this one battle...|Grado forces were being overwhelmed.
speak;Amelia;Everyone else retreated or fell...|But Gheb was hit by three arrows and kept fighting.|The arrows barely penetrated his... um...
speak;Amelia;His... fat.|He was so large that the arrows couldn't reach any vital organs.|He survived long enough for reinforcements to arrive.
speak;Vanessa;So his... girth... saved him?|That's certainly an unusual qualification for command.
speak;Amelia;General Duessel told me they gave him a command position after that.|Though I think it was just to get him away from the main army.
speak;Franz;Amelia! Dame Vanessa!|Sorry to interrupt.|Prince Ephraim asked me to let you know we'll be moving out at dawn.
speak;Franz;Has Dame Vanessa been showing you the ropes?|Prince Ephraim speaks very highly of her tactics.
speak;Vanessa;We were just getting acquainted.|Amelia was telling me about her previous commander.
speak;Franz;Oh...|You mean that Gheb fellow?|I heard he met his end recently.
speak;Amelia;Yes...|And I can't say I mourn him.|Is that terrible of me?
speak;Vanessa;Not at all.|A commander who abuses their position doesn't deserve respect.
speak;Franz;Prince Ephraim always says a true leader earns respect through actions, not rank.|That's why we follow him so willingly.
speak;Amelia;It's still strange sometimes...|To be fighting under a different banner.
speak;Amelia;No.|None at all.|Prince Ephraim is everything a commander should be.
speak;Vanessa;He leads from the front.|Never asks his soldiers to take risks he wouldn't take himself.
speak;Amelia;And he treats everyone with respect.|Even a former enemy like me.
speak;Vanessa;You're one of us now, Amelia.|No one thinks of you as an enemy.
speak;Amelia;Thank you, Dame Vanessa.|That means a lot coming from you.
speak;Vanessa;Please, just Vanessa is fine.|We're comrades now.
speak;Amelia;Comrades...|I like the sound of that.
speak;Vanessa;Have you been assigned to a unit yet?|If not, you're welcome to join mine.|I could use another lance at my side.
speak;Amelia;R-really?|You'd want me in your unit?
speak;Vanessa;Of course.|I've seen you train.|You have potential, Amelia.
speak;Amelia;I... I would be honored!|I'll work hard not to disappoint you!
speak;Vanessa;I have no doubt of that.|Now, we should probably prepare for tomorrow's march.|Prince Ephraim doesn't tolerate tardiness.
speak;Amelia;Right!|I'll be ready before dawn!|Thank you again, Dame Vane—I mean, Vanessa!
speak;Vanessa;Until tomorrow then, Amelia.|And if you ever need to talk...|My tent is always open.
